intro: Diplolaena microcephala var. velutina, commonly known as the velvet leaf diplolaena, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its small, velvety leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is relatively rare in the wild.
